listings.Description of job/activites: Our Markets business is part of our Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) function. We provide clients with risk management, financing and investment expertise, through bespoke solutions across asset classes and building trusted relationships in various industries and sectors. We provide clients with an in-depth knowledge of local markets as well as our global product expertise to offer the best financial solutions. Our strong and deep local presence enables us to help co-create bespoke financing solutions and connect our clients multilaterally to investors, suppliers, buyers and sellers. Our products and services enable our clients to move capital, manage risk and invest to create wealth. Our clients represent a large and important part of the economies we serve. CIB is at the heart of the Group’s purpose to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity. Interns will perform two rotations from the following areas: Sales, Trading, Structuring and Research. Sales develop and maintain relationships with institutional clients and pitch investment strategies. Traders make market positions and buy and sell securities. Structuring specialises in modelling and complex asset classes. Business Platforms is responsible for delivering financial market products. Research provides investment opportunities, market insights, and risk management advice.
listings.Requirements/qualifications: We welcome students from all degree disciplines and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds. We’re looking for team players with excellent academic achievements and extracurricular activities, agile multi-taskers who can handle pressure, analytical minds with numeracy and attention to detail. You’ll be a penultimate year student, able to intern in June 2025 and start full time employment in July 2026, with the permanent legal right to work in the country you’re applying to.
